quoteFirst: The space between the Rocky Mountains and Rein-deer Hills, ninety miles in length from lat. 67 degrees
quoteLast: 9 degrees 10 minutes, and from fifteen to forty miles in width, is occupied by flat alluvial islands, which separate the various branches of the river. Most of these islands are partially or entirely flooded in the spring, and have their centres depressed and marshy, or occupied by a lake; whilst their borders are higher and well clothed by white spruce trees.

quoteLast: . In front of the clock was a lady's fan, though from the marks on the wall paper the water had been over all these things.

quoteFirst: -Colonel Thorne sent forward guides to make themselves thoroughly acquainted with the assembly position, so that they might lead the Battalion to its destination without delay. This comparatively simple task was not without danger, and when Second Lieutenant Greenhill, who was in charge of the guides, met the Battalion at Wood 15, his party had already suffered six casualties. At
quoteLast: the attack commenced, and the leading Battalions started off preceded by a barrage. The Broembeek was crossed without difficulty, and the first objective was secured according to the scheduled time.
title: The Grenadier Guards in the Great War of 1914-1918, Vol. 2 of 3

quoteFirst: There was some shelling as they got into their assembly positions at
quoteLast: , but casualties were few. The 2nd Grenadiers and 2nd Coldstream led off under a few minutes’ blast of intense fire from field-guns and Stokes mortars, crossed the Broembeek and were away. At 6.20 the 1st Irish Guards and 3rd Coldstream followed them.
title: The Irish Guards in the Great War, Volume 1 (of 2)
